member.name: T:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.IAttachable
member.summary: Interface implemented by controls which can be dynamically attached to the editor and detached from it. If control implements this interface then it will receive attach and detach notifications through it.

remarks.p: It is recommended that external controls implement default constructor and this interface, this allows them to be dynamically activated when attached to the editor and be functional in the design mode.
If control subscribes to events from the editor or objects provided by the editor then it shall unsubscribe from these events and dispose object references when detached.

member.summary: A collection of built-in document properties.

remarks.p: A document has a standard set of informational properties, they are called built-in document properties.
provides access to objects by their names (using an indexer) and via a set of typed properties such as , and so on that return values of appropriate types.
You do not create instances of this class directly. You access built-in document properties via the property.

member.name: P:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.BuiltInDocumentProperties.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a object by the name of the property.

remarks.p: The string names of the properties correspond to the names of the typed properties available from .

If you request a property that is not present in the document, but the name of the property is recognized as a valid built-in name, a new is created, added to the collection and returned. The newly created property is assigned a default value (empty string, zero, false or DateTime.MinValue depending on the type of the built-in property).
If you request a property that is not present in the document and the name is not recognized as a built-in name, a null is returned.

member.name: T:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Selection
member.summary: Represents either a selected (highlighted) text in the editor control, or the insertion point if nothing in the document is selected.

remarks.p: Use the property of the class to return the current selection. You do not create instances of directly.
The object has various methods and properties that allow you to expand, collapse or otherwise change the current selection: , , and so on.
The object has various methods and properties with which you can edit selected text: , , , and so on.
Use the property to obtain a range that represents the current selection. The object provides more methods and properties to programmatically edit and format the text.

member.name: M:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Selection.TypeBackspace
member.summary: Types the BACKSPACE key.

remarks.p: Deletes the character preceding a collapsed selection (an insertion point). If the selection isn't collapsed to an insertion point, the selection is deleted.

member.name: M:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Selection.TypeDelete
member.summary: Types the DELETE key.

remarks.p: Deletes the character following a collapsed selection (an insertion point).
If the selection isn't collapsed to an insertion point, the selection is deleted.
Last paragraph break in the document cannot be deleted.

member.name: M:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Selection.TypeParagraph
member.summary: Types the ENTER key.

remarks.p: Inserts a new, blank paragraph. If the selection isn't collapsed to an insertion point it is replaced by the new paragraph.

member.name: M:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Selection.TypeText(System.String)
member.summary: Inserts the specified text at the insertion point.

remarks.p: If the selection isn't collapsed to an insertion point it is replaced by the specified text.
Note that when paragraph break character is selected and is at the end of the selection, it is not replaced.

member.name: M:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Selection.TypeTab
member.summary: Types the TAB key.

member.summary: Moves the active end of the selection up or down.

The number of units the selection is to be moved. If the value is positive then the active end of the selection moves down. If the value is negative then the active end of the selection moves up.

member.name: M:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Selection.MoveEnd(Aspose.Editor.Desktop.MoveUnitHorizontal,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the ending character position of the selection. The selection is extended or shrinked as a result.
member.param: The unit by which to move the ending character position.
The number of units to move. If this number is positive, the ending character position is moved forward in the document. If this number is negative, the end is moved backward.
member.remarks: If the ending position overtakes the starting position, the selection collapses and both character positions move together.

member.name: M:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Selection.MoveStart(Aspose.Editor.Desktop.MoveUnitHorizontal,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the start character position of the selection. The selection is extended or shrinked as a result.
member.param: The unit by which start position of the selection is to be moved.
The number of units to move. If this number is positive, the start character position is moved forward in the document. If this number is negative, the start is moved backward.
member.remarks: If the start position is moved forward to a position beyond the end position, the selection is collapsed and both the start and end positions are moved together.

member.name: T:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.EditorBars
member.summary: Represents collection of the controls which appear in the editor control client area. Controls include main menu, status bar, scroll bars, tool bars and rulers.

remarks.p: Application can use any custom implementation of the controls, e.g. you can use your own custom scroll bar or menu. It is recommended that custom controls implement interface thought it is not required.

member.name: T:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Range
member.summary: Represents a contiguous area in a document. is the main class to programmatically access and modify text and formatting in a document.

remarks.p: Each object is defined by a starting and ending character position. objects are used to identify specific portions of a document that you want to access or modify.

If you look at the whole document as a string of text with formatting attributes applied at certain positions, then the object is like a "window" into that string. Through a your code can "see" and modify text and formatting of the document, but the itself does not store any text or formatting in it.

objects are not visible objects and are independent of the selection. That is, you can define and manipulate a range without changing the selection. You can also define multiple ranges in a document, while there can be only one selection.

You do not create objects directly. You obtain ranges using the method from various objects, such as , and . You can obtain that corresponds to the current selection in the editor via the property of the object. Once a object is created, it continues to exist until no other objects reference it.

The property specifies the start of the range which is the first character included in the range. The property specifies the number of characters in the range. The property is simply plus and specifies the end of the range. As an example, if is 0 and is 5, then is also 5 and characters 0, 1, 2, 3 and 4 are included in the range. Note that character at position 5 is not included in the range.

objects are always "alive", that is they are updated whenever the underlying document changes (possibly via other existing objects). As a result of such updates, existing objects can expand or collapse. For example, if you had one object for character positions 0-20 and then characters 5-10 were deleted by the user editing in the control or programmatically via another object, then the first object will be updated so it covers characters 0-15. Similarly, inserting characters would have expanded the range.

An interesting situation occurs when getting or setting formating through a object that includes text with different formatting. For example, a single range can include text that is bold and not bold, paragraphs that are left-aligned and centered, etc. The description below applies to any type of formatting: character, paragraph or section.

A consecutive series of characters in a document that have same character formatting is called a "run". A single or can encompass a number of runs with different formatting, but a single is always returned.

For example, a single can include characters of two runs, first run is bold and second run is not bold. In this case, properties of the object return the value from the first run in the range, that is will return true.

When setting any of the properties for a range that contains multiple runs, the new value is applied to all characters within the range. In the above case, setting to true, will make all characters in the range bold.

member.returns: A object that allows to access the result of the find operation and execute replace.

remarks.p: This method executes find only. The text is not automatically replaced. You need to work with the object returned by this method if you want to actually replace text.

member.name: M:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Range.CopyDocument
member.summary: Returns content of the range as a separate document. You can use this property to copy text and formatting of the range.

member.name: M:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Range.PasteDocument(Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Document)
member.summary: Sets content of the range from a document. You can use this property to paste text and formatting into the range.

member.name: M:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Range.ClearFormatting
member.summary: Clears the formatting of range.
member.remarks: If range contains a whole paragraph or intersects more then one paragraph this method also clears the paragraph formatting and applies the "Normal" paragraph style if available. If range has zero length it is the same as the whole paragraph is selected.

member.name: M:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Range.ClearFormatting(Aspose.Editor.Core.Document.RunType)
member.summary: Clears formatting of object of specified type inside the range.

member.name: P:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Range.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text in the range.

remarks.p: The property returns the plain, unformatted text of the range. When you set this property, the text of the range is replaced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Range.IsEmpty
member.summary: Returns True if the range has zero length.

member.name: P:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Range.Start
member.summary: Gets or sets the starting character position of the range.

remarks.p: Character positions in a document are 0-based.
Normally, setting the property also modifies the property. However, if is set to a value larger than that of the property, the property is set to the same value as that of the property.
The starting character position is relative to the beginning of the story.

The property specifies the start of the range which is the first character included in the range. The property specifies the number of characters in the range. The property is simply plus and specifies the end of the range. As an example, if is 0 and is 5, then is also 5 and characters 0, 1, 2, 3 and 4 are included in the range. Note that character at position 5 is not included in the range.

member.name: P:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Range.End
member.summary: Gets or sets the ending character position of the range.

remarks.p: Character positions in a document are 0-based.
Normally, setting the property also modifies the property, but if is set to a value smaller than the property, the property is set to the same value.
The ending character position is relative to the beginning of the story.

The property specifies the start of the range which is the first character included in the range. The property specifies the number of characters in the range. The property is simply plus and specifies the end of the range. As an example, if is 0 and is 5, then is also 5 and characters 0, 1, 2, 3 and 4 are included in the range. Note that character at position 5 is not included in the range.

member.name: P:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Range.Length
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of the range in character positions.

remarks.p: Setting the property also modifies the property.

The property specifies the start of the range which is the first character included in the range. The property specifies the number of characters in the range. The property is simply plus and specifies the end of the range. As an example, if is 0 and is 5, then is also 5 and characters 0, 1, 2, 3 and 4 are included in the range. Note that character at position 5 is not included in the range.

member.name: P:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Range.StyleName
member.summary: Gets or sets the style applied to this range by style name.

remarks.p: The way the style is applied to the range depends on the style type. If you apply a character style, then the style is applied to all runs of text inside this range. If you apply a paragraph style, then the style is applied to all paragraphs that are fully or partially contained in the range.

member.name: T:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.License
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]

member.name: M:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
1. Explicit path.
2. The folder of the component assembly.
3. The folder of the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder of the entry assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
1. Explicit path.
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic") Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.name: T:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.PageRenderer
member.summary: Renders document pages into a .NET object. The rendered pages look like output from Microsoft Word.

remarks.p: allows you to quickly and easily create thumbnails or images of individual document pages as well as implement print and preview. All this is possible thanks to the versatility of GDI+ and its main class .
You can obtain or create a object that represents a display, raster image, metafile, or a printer device. Pass this object to and the document will be rendered on that device.

The Aspose.Editor.Demo project with source code is included in the Aspose.Editor installer. The demo project shows how to use to create PNG, JPEG and EMF files of document pages (one page per file), as well as how to create a single multipage TIFF file that contains all pages of a document. You can also specify image scale or dimensions as well as desired resolution.

member.name: M:Aspose.Editor.PluginMember.Invoke(System.Object[])
member.summary: Invokes this member using reflection.
member.param:
Arguments.
If member is method, then values in the list must match in type, position and number to the parameters found in the method signature,
If member is indexed property "this", then when Set first argument is value, remaining arguments are indices, returned is Null; when Get arguments are indices, returned is property value,
If member is regular property, then when Set single argument is value, returned is Null; when Get then no arguments must be specified (empty array or Null), returned is property value.

member.name: T:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Paragraph
member.summary: Represents a single paragraph of text in a .

remarks.p: You do not create instances of this class directly. You can create or obtain objects from the collection. The collection, in turn, is available from a object.

A paragraph of text in a document and a instance are distinct entities. Although a document consists of paragraphs of text, individual objects are not automatically created for each and every paragraph of text when the document is loaded as it would be a waste of system resources. Also, paragraphs of text are often joined and split because of the editing operations. Therefore, objects are proxy-like objects that are automatically created and maintained by Aspose.Editor on demand, to make it easier for you to work with the document programmatically.

member.name: T:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Font
member.summary: Represents character formatting attributes (font name, font size, color, and so on) of an object.

remarks.p: You do not create instances of the class directly. You access as a property of objects that can have character formatting, for example of the object.

A consecutive series of characters in a document that have same character formatting is called a "run". A single or can encompass a number of runs with different formatting, but a single is always returned.

For example, a single can include characters of two runs, first run is bold and second run is not bold. In this case, properties of the object return the value from the first run in the range, that is will return true.

When setting any of the properties for a range that contains multiple runs, the new value is applied to all characters within the range. In the above case, setting to true, will make all characters in the range bold.

member.name: T:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Paragraphs
member.summary: A collection of objects in a .

remarks.p: Use the property of the object to return a collection. You do not create instances of the class directly.
Use the method to add a new paragraph to a document. Alternatively use the , or methods of the object to add new paragraphs to a document.
Use the property to return a single object.
A collection is always "live". Any changes made to the document (possibly via other collections) are reflected in all existing collections.
This is a "live" collection of document elements so getting might sometimes have to recalculate the number of items. Consider caching the value of in time-critical loops.

member.name: T:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.EditorControl
member.summary: This is the control that you can place into a Windows Form to create a word processor.

remarks.p: By default, is installed in the Visual Studio .NET Toolbox, in the Aspose.Editor tab. To use in your application, your need to create a Windows Form and drag from the Toolbox into your form. You can also instantiate using a constructor.
The editor control and the document are separate entities. The allows to display and edit a .
When is created, it has no document in it and displays empty background. You need to create or open a document for editing by using one of the methods. Use or to save or close the current document.

You can also open, save and directly access the current document inside the editor control via the property. By setting the property you specify what document is open in the editor control for editing.
Use the property to access and modify the currently selected text in the document.
Use the collection to invoke standard editor dialogs such as Font, Paragraph, Columns and Page Setup. The dialogs modify formatting of the current selection.
All editing and formatting operations can be undone via the and methods of .

handles most of the standard text processor shortcuts, e.g. Ctrl+A, Ctrl+C, Ctrl+V, Ctrl+Insert, Shift+Delete and others. For this reason there is no need for the control container to define and handle such shortcuts.
derives from and inherits all its methods and properties. For more information, see MSDN for the class.
Although you can use this constructor to create new instances of the class, normally, you would drag from the Toolbox into your Windows Form and will not create instances directly.
After is created, you need to open a document for editing by using or by setting the property.

member.name: M:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.EditorControl.Open
member.summary: Creates a blank document and opens it in the editor.

remarks.p: This is a shortcut for EditorControl.Document = new Aspose.Editor.Document().
If there is another document already open in the editor, it is discarded.

member.name: M:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.EditorControl.Open(System.String)
member.summary: Loads a document from a file and opens it in the editor.

remarks.p: This is a shortcut for EditorControl.Document = new Aspose.Editor.Document(fileName).
If there is another document already open in the editor, it is discarded.
The document is loaded into memory completely. The file is closed.
Aspose.Editor supports documents in the following formats:

member.param: File name of the document to open.

member.name: M:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.EditorControl.Save(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the current document to a file in the WordprocessingML format.

remarks.p: This is a shortcut for EditorControl.Document.Save(fileName).
If a document with the specified file name already exists, the existing document is overwritten.

member.name: M:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.EditorControl.Open(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Loads a document from a stream and opens it in the editor.

remarks.p: This is a shortcut for EditorControl.Document = new Aspose.Editor.Document(stream).
If there is another document already open in the editor, it is discarded.
The stream must be open and the position in the stream should be properly set to the beginning of the document.
The document is loaded into memory completely. The stream is not needed and can be closed after the document is loaded. It is the caller's responsibility to close/dispose the stream.
This operation does not close the stream and leaves the position at the end of the stream.
Aspose.Editor supports documents in the following formats:

member.summary: Closes the current document in the editor without saving changes.

remarks.p: This is a shortcut for EditorControl.Document = null.

member.name: M:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.EditorControl.Recover(System.Exception)
member.summary: Recovers control after internal error.
member.returns: Positive value if recovered, in this case application can ignore exception and continue using control. Zero if failed, in this case application must either terminate or re-create control. Negative value if exception wasn't thrown by control.
member.remarks: This method must be called from within catch clause when exception is caught by the application.

member.name: E:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.EditorControl.ContentChanged
member.summary: Occurs when text in the document is inserted or removed.

remarks.p: This event is fired when content is inserted, removed or replaced in the document.
The event provides three integer values: Start, EndBefore and EndAfter. These values describe the changed range in the document in the following way:

list.item: If Start = EndBefore then range (Start, EndAfter) was inserted,
If Start = EndAfter then range (Start, EndBefore) was removed,
Otherwise range (Start, EndBefore) was replaced with range (Start, EndAfter).

remarks.note: The event is fired after the change has been already applied. There is no way for the application to get the text which has been removed or replaced.
remarks.p: This event is not fired when formatting in the document is changed.

member.name: P:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.EditorControl.ActiveView
member.summary: Gets current active view control of the editor. If there is no opened document in the editor this property returns null.

member.name: E:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.EditorControl.Idle
member.summary: Occurs when control has just finished processing and now is idle.

remarks.p: This event is not guaranteed to occur after each action performed, instead it occurs after 10-100ms interval elapses since the last action has been performed.
This event is usually used to update state of the interface elements like menu items and tool bar buttons.

member.name: E:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.EditorControl.AttributesChanged
member.summary: Occurs when text attributes change.

remarks.p: This event is fired when formatting of the document range is changed.
remarks.note: The event is fired after the change has been already applied. There is no way for the application to get attributes which have been changed.

summary.p: The Aspose.Editor.Desktop namespace contains classes of the word processor control for Windows Forms .NET and classes of the document object model. While the control can be used in Windows Forms applications only, the classes of the document object model can be used in any .NET application to programmatically work with Microsoft Word documents. The following are the main classes:

list.item: is a word processor control that you can drag and drop onto your Windows Form.
represents a Microsoft Word document that can be opened inside the editor control.
allows to programmatically (without user interface) manipulate content and formatting of the document.
represents selected text in the editor.
renders pages of a document to a .NET object to create thumbnails or print.

summary.p: Aspose.Editor is written completely in C#, CLS compliant and contains only safe managed code. Microsoft Word is not required in order to use Aspose.Editor.

member.name: T:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.PleaseReportException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when an unexpected situation occurs during processing of a document.

remarks.p: When this exception is thrown, it is not likely that you did something wrong. Most likely causes of this exception are: badly damaged document file, unexpected elements or values in the document that cannot be safely ignored or an Aspose.Editor internal error.

Therefore, the message of the exception suggests that you report it in the Aspose.Editor Support Forums (http://www.aspose.com/Community/Forums/Default.aspx) along with the document that caused the problem for Aspose.Editor developers to investigate and fix.

Use the property to return a single object.
In the current version, it is not possible to add new sections to the collection.
A collection is always "live". Any changes made to the document are reflected in all existing collections.
This is a "live" collection of document elements so getting might sometimes have to recalculate the number of items. Consider caching the value of in time-critical loops.

member.name: T:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Document
member.summary: Represents a Microsoft Word document.

remarks.p: To load an existing document, pass a file name or a stream into one of the constructors. To create a blank document, call the constructor without parameters.
Use one of the method overloads to save the document into a file or stream.
After a document is loaded, you can open the document for editing inside an by setting the property of the object.

A can be opened, saved and programmatically modified without being made visible to the user in the editor control. The class provides methods and properties to programmatically manipulate content of the document via the object in a manner, similar to Microsoft Word Automation. Use methods to obtain objects.
All editing and formatting operations you perform on a are logged into the undo list and can be undone using the method and redone using the method.
Aspose.Editor supports documents in the following formats:

member.name: M:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Document.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a blank document.

remarks.p: The document paper size is Letter by default. If you want to change page setup, use the property of the object.

member.name: M:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Document.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Loads an existing WordprocessingML document from a file.

remarks.p: The document is loaded into memory completely. The file is closed.
Aspose.Editor supports documents in the following formats:

member.param: File name of the document to open.

member.name: M:Aspose.Editor.Desktop.Document.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Loads an existing WordprocessingML document from a stream.

remarks.p: The stream must be open and the position in the stream should be properly set to the beginning of the document.
The document is loaded into memory completely. The stream is not needed and can be closed after the document is loaded. It is the caller's responsibility to close/dispose the stream.
This operation does not close the stream and leaves the position at the end of the stream.
Aspose.Editor supports documents in the following formats:
